intro: Rinorea dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking bi-colored leaves, which often display a combination of green and silver or white hues. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and bloom in clusters. Rinorea dichroa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate appearance.
